entry.title: Milkie Way (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a performance by Milkie Way (pictured) at the 2021 Heavy Music Awards got its Twitch stream banned for three days?

entry.title: abortions in Eswatini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that women seeking abortions in Eswatini or in Lesotho may travel to neighbouring South Africa, where it is legal?

entry.title: New Zealand mayor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand mayor Georgina Beyer was the world's first openly transgender mayor?

entry.title: Norwegian Soy Flour Plant in Larvik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during World War II an armed resistance group was based at the Norwegian Soy Flour Plant in Larvik?

entry.title: Moain Sadeq (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Moain Sadeq led excavations at Tell es-Sakan in the Gaza Strip, the oldest-known ancient Egyptian fortification to be excavated?

entry.title: Richard Swanson died (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Richard Swanson died while trying to dribble a soccer ball from Seattle to São Paulo?

entry.title: 2022 North Lanarkshire Council election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the British Unionist Party won their first elected representative in a "devastating upset" at the 2022 North Lanarkshire Council election?

entry.title: Cobra Crack (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Didier Berthod failed to make the first free ascent of Cobra Crack in 2005, he quit climbing and became a Franciscan monk?

entry.title: Aoi Koga (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that voice actress Aoi Koga has an interest in manhole covers?
